TravelTriangle > Blog > Places To Visit > 19 Beaches Near Ahmedabad Which Will Let You Get Over The Monotonous Life In 2025! 19 Beaches Near Ahmedabad Which Will Let You Get Over The Monotonous Life In 2025! .. SHARES Updated Date: 13 December 2024 Ahmedabad is popular for its industrial revolution and the badge of business that it carries along with it. However, the beaches and coastline are quite far away from the core city of Ahmedabad. If you are planning a trip of around more than 3 days to a week, you can hit Goa or Maharashtra. In Gujrat, there are a few beaches, but to explore the vast variety of beaches and forts and nature, Goa and Maharashtra are nearer coastlines. You can visit nearby places and explore the historic importance of each one along with visiting these beautiful beaches near Ahmedabad. Table Of Content 19 Best Beaches Near Ahmedabad Here is a list of beaches near Ahmedabad which one must visit when they are planning a holiday in Gujarat and have a great time sitting by the surreal scenery.  Dandi Beach Kutch Beach Diu Coastal line Somnath Mandir Beaches Porbandar Dwarka Beach Alibag Beach Raigad Beaches Kashid Beach Diveagar Beach Harihareshwar Beach Mandvi Beach Dumas Beach Sarkeshwar Beach Beyt Island Devka Beach Nagoa Beach Gomtimata Beach Jallandhar Beach 1. Dandi Beach The city is the bulk and core area of the state of Gujarat and can easily be falsified in the center of Indian fabrics. Located on the banks of the Tapi River, here is all the fuss. This is not only one of the fastest-growing cities, but also houses the greatest monuments and architectural wonders. Famous for cutting and polishing diamonds, the letter is called “The city of diamonds”. With so many conversations that it is the busiest city in India, it also hosts many tourists throughout the year. The life of this city can be fast, but the rich and vibrant Gujrati culture is well-preserved thanks to the perfect combination of historical gems and modern Gujrat. From quiet beaches to magnificent temples, whether you’re planning a family vacation or a business trip, Diamond City has a lot to offer and meets all your needs. EMI option available. Book Now See more at TRAVELTRIANGLE.COM Visit Website 2. Kutch Beach The beautiful sea of ​​white sand has fascinated the world for centuries. Kutch, the Indian state of the prince, is one of the most popular tourist destinations, especially in February. Rabbit huts are the best thing in the world. India “Wild West” is endowed with a wealth of culture and ecology. The rich species of nature act as add-on beauty, especially when it is the favorite home of migratory birds in winter. Famous for its arts and crafts, Kutch is home to the famous Mandvi beach and truly worth a visit. The best time to visit Kutch starts in October and lasts until March, because it is the time when the raw marshes dry up, leaving a white paradise. Rann Utsav is also a popular time when people from all over the world visit Kutch to see its abundance of culture and unique traditions. Rann Utsav starts in November and ends in February when more accommodation options will be available. Location: 288 kilometers from AhmedabadAttractions: Little rann of Kutch Suggested Read: 15 Romantic Restaurants In Ahmedabad That’ll Fill Your Dinner Date With Love! 3. Diu Coastal Line Diu is a small island located at the southern tip of Saurashtra in Gujarat. Diu is a separate region from Gujarat. It is actually a separate Union Territory known as Daman and Diu and has its own rules and government. Inspiration source of the territory is found in Portuguese history and techniques and in Portuguese culture. The city streets are perfect, sparkling and calm when you get off the tourist embankment belt and there are a variety of destroyed Portuguese houses and houses of worship. Tourists will love the dazzling mix of sun, sand, and sea, an island with swaying palm trees, gentle breezes, and floods of the Arabian Sea surrounding the coast. Blessed with an extraordinary atmosphere, this is an oasis of beauty, peace, and tranquility. Location: 304 kilometers from AhmedabadAttractions: Ghogla beach, INS Khukri Memorial Suggested Read: Top 12 Surreal And Romantic Places Near Ahmedabad Where The Love Birds Flock! 4. Somnath Mandir Beaches For those who are religious and know the history of Shiva, this place is perfect. In Shiva Purana and Nandi Upapurana, Shiva is said to be – It is everywhere, but it is symbolically in twelve forms and places. These points are known as jyotirlingas and Somnath was the first to be found on this planet. Located in Gujarat, Somnath takes its name from the acclaimed Somnath temple, Somnath, which means the Gods of the Moon. Basically a temple city, Somnath is a place where strong aromas of religion and legends await the industry. everyday Unusual conditions are adorned with a number of giant temples in this region as much as possible, Somnath also offers quiet beaches, exhibition halls, and various other tourist attractions. The Somnath temple is celebrated as a shrine of Jyotirling, which is loved and adored by Hindus throughout India. Location: 326 kilometers from AhmedabadAttractions: Geeta temple, Suraj Mandir Suggested Read: 20 Best Resorts Near Ahmedabad: Guide To Your Vacation Hotspots 5. Porbandar Porbandar is one of the most beautiful seaside towns in Gujarat that is always characterized by sandy landscapes and champagne holidays. This is a beautiful coastal city located in the western part of the Indian state, which, in addition to being a shared paradise as a beach lover, also invests with all its heart in the country home of Mahatma Gandhi and is an example of the friendship of Sudama ( Friends of Lord Krishna). Porbandar Bird Sanctuary, Miyani Beach, Barda Hills Wildlife Sanctuary, Kirti Mandir and Porbandar Beach are some of the most important places to visit in Porbandar. Kirti Mandir is the place of residence of Gandhiji and his predecessor who is still alive in the form of the exhibition hall. The atmosphere here is generally beautiful and the winter period, which lasts from November to February, is often a visit to Porbandar. Location: 339 kilometers from AhmedabadAttractions: Nehru Planetarium Suggested Read: 20 Gujarati Dishes That Will Always Have A Sweet Spot In Your Heart! 6. Dwarka Beach Not after the death, but while you are still on earth you can be in God’s house. Ever wonder what it’s like to be in God’s house? You will find out during your visit to the holy city of Dwarka. The smell of incense, the sound of temple bells, the calm of the river and many mythical stories to hear: the city of Dwarka offers all this and much more. Dwarka, the stunning kingdom of Lord Krishna, is located in the state of Gujarat in northwestern India. It is one of the best Chardham comprising four places/palaces and one of Sapta Puris aka seven holiest Hindu cities. It is famous not only for temples but also for exotic marine life, water sports, and camping. Dwarka, as a small town, is a center for pilots and adventurers. The best time to visit is Janmashtami which is Krishna’s birthday. Location: 380 kilometers from AhmedabadAttractions: Dwarkadheesh Temple Suggested Read: 17 Famous Festivals In Gujarat To Celebrate With Joyous Fervor 7. Alibag Beach The small coastal town of Alibag, elegantly hidden in the Konkan region of Maharashtra, is one of the most popular starting points near Mumbai. Every year, many tourists visit this small city to enjoy the beautiful scenery and beautiful architecture. Alibag and the surrounding villages, located 120 km south of Mumbai, are firmly rooted in their colonial history. Sandy beaches, clear skies, clean air, beautiful fortresses, and royal temples. Being in Mumbai, visit this amazing city. The core attraction of Alibag is the beach. Not far from each other, with spectacular sunset views, walking along the beach, enjoying the sunset, enjoying the breeze, embracing the beauty around you, Alibag is the right place to relax and start from the beginning. Alibag is a house on the coast of Mandwa, famous for its many films. With amazing views from the Gulf Gate of Indian Alibag, this is a place for art and nature lovers. Location: 487 kilometers from AhmedabadAttractions: Hanuman Temple, Kanakeshwar forest Suggested Read: This Charming Couple’s Mauritius Tour From Ahmedabad Was Full Of Thrill And Romance 8. Raigad Beaches It is out of Gujarat, the Raigar district is in Maharashtra which was formerly known as the Kolaba district before Fort Raigad became the first capital of the Maratha Empire. It is located in the Konkan Maharashtra region and is moved from the ports of Mumbai, Thane, Pune, Ratnagiri and the Arabian Sea. According to the story, the Rahat collection of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj won this place in 1656. His government later moved to Raigad. Raigad Fortress talked about the volume and supported the Maratha government. The magnetic aura around the castle is very fascinating. It was built on unfinished stone and at a sufficient height. Samadhi (grave) Shivaji is another tourist attraction for people who visit this place. Many fortresses of Raigad are known throughout the country and during the historical wars to narrate the environment in the books.Location: 505 kilometers from AhmedabadAttractions: Fort Raigad Suggested Read: 51 Incomparable Places To Visit In Gujarat For A Memorable Trip 9. Kashid Beach Kashid is a coastal city considered a mainstream due to the white sand and blue ocean in the Konkan Maharkan region. It’s the perfect place for a peaceful end to a week’s escape from Mumbai. A peaceful and peaceful place surrounded by nature, Kashid is quite charming because of its peaceful location and pleasant surroundings. This coastal city is also famous for the beautiful mountains and murmuring forests of Casuarina. A beautiful place for people looking for a quiet and peaceful environment – Kashid has a quiet beach that stretches very widely and seems enchanted. Located near Kashid, Chaul has many Buddhist slaves open to intrigue and there are many famous houses of worship and temples in Kashid. Korlai Fort is another pleasant attraction. The ideal time to visit this aesthetic place is from October to February. Location: 511 kilometers from AhmedabadAttractions: Janjira Fort Suggested Read: 10 Best Places To Visit In Gujarat In Summer For An Enthralling Holiday 10. Diveagar Beach Diveagar is one of the beautiful coastal villages along the Konkan coastline in the Raigad district of Maharashtra, India. The gateway to the coastline has a dense cover of Belu trees, which is generally unusual in this region along with various Suru or Casuarina trees that are common in the coastal part of Maharashtra. This beach is a combination of three coastlines in the Raigad district, one is Diveagar beach and the other is Harihareshwar and Shreevardhan. Near Diveagar is the city of Devkhol, which has an ancient temple known for its intricate statues. Various places to visit from Diveagar include Janjira Fort and Padmadurg. This unusual place also has a special attraction for pedestrians who are the path to the Citadel of Madagascar. Because it is a hot summer, it is best to enjoy the beach in the middle of the rainy season and winter. Location: 539 kilometers from AhmedabadAttractions: Kalbhairav, Shankar Temple Suggested Read: Street Food In Ahmedabad: 19 Best Food Spots That You Need To Add To Your List! 11. Harihareshwar Beach Harihareshwar, a small coastal town in Maharashtra, is located in the Raigad district of Maharashtra. It is surrounded on three sides by three hills called Harihareshwar, Harshinachal, and Pushpadri. In addition to having a waterfront on the fourth side, the Savitri River flows into the Arabian Sea, which flows through the city of Harihareshwar. Besides being an important pilgrimage center, Harihareshwar also serves as a resort with two beautiful beaches, namely Harihaeshwar beach. There are also two other beaches, Divegar and Shrivardhan. This is a geographical position that makes it very attractive, a hill on three sides, the sea on the fourth side, while a beautiful river flows through it, creating a complete package. Harihareshwar offers the right opportunity to tour with spirituality and beautiful beaches side by side, nothing can calm your soul more than being in nature with the spiritual attitudinal sense. Location: 561 kilometers from AhmedabadAttractions: Temples and Shopping 12. Mandvi Beach Located in the Kutch region in Gujarat, the Mandvi beach is one of the beautiful beaches near Ahmedabad. Boasting the beach sandshores, this place is truly a tranquil paradise to enjoy adventure activities and relax. Resting close to the Vijay Vilas palace estate in Bhuj, this beach still remains undiscovered and offers a relaxing getaway. Distance From Ahmedabad: 333 Kms Attractions: Kutch desert, Vijay Vilas Palace 13. Dumas Beach This is an urban beach which is situated adjacent to the Arabian sea and located at a distance of 21 km from Surat City. It is a black sand beach which stands out from all the other beaches and alongside that there are incidents of disappearances which makes it one of the haunted places in India. The sand on the beach has a high iron concentration which gives it an eerie black colour. Distance From Ahmedabad: 283 Kms Attractions: Dariya Ganesh temple, Morarji Desai Circle 14. Sarkeshwar Beach Surrounding the Junagadh city and also the neighbouring city of Amreli, the Sarkeshwar Beach is considered to be one of the best beaches near Ahmedabad. This place is not just famous for its tranquil beauty but also the amazing water sports activities which makes it thrilling to visit. Situated at Saurashtra’s southern tip, the beach is located at the outskirts of the city which takes around 4 hours of long drive. Distance From Ahmedabad: 342 Kms Attractions: Girnar Hill, Mahabat Maqbara 15. Beyt Island Situated at a distance of 30 kms from Dwarka, the Beyt Island is an isolated and small island which was once the main port of the region during Okha development. While there are a few temples to explore, this place is also known for its vast sea and white sand beach which is also a home to the coral reefs. This is one of the famous beaches near Ahmedabad where people visit to enjoy things like sea excursions, picnics and camping. Distance From Ahmedabad: 462 Kms Attractions: NA  16. Devka Beach This is considered to be a pure bliss for the people who want to witness the beautiful sunset and also enjoy a tropical vacation. Like the other beaches in Daman, this beach is also known for its untouched beauty. Alongside that the place also boasts fresh clear water and a clean shoreline to enjoy a great time. Distance From Ahmedabad: 361 Kms Attractions: Mirasol Lake Garden, Jampore Beach 17. Nagoa Beach  Known for its surreal beauty and also the hanging palm trees, Nagoa beach is a treat to the eyes. This beach is located close to the resorts and also gives a relaxing space for the visitors to enjoy. The beach is situated at the Nagoa hamlet at the Bucharwada village and offers a view of the Hoka trees which is known for a unique kind of fruit. Alongside that, the place is also known for other things like water sports and pony riding. Distance From Ahmedabad: 368 Kms Attractions: Diu Fort, Naida Caves 18. Gomtimata Beach Situated at the western edge of Edge, the Gomtimata beach is considered to be one of the best beaches to experience a beautiful view and relax. Resting away from the hustle-bustle, this white sandy pristine beach attracts visitors and gives them a place to relax. But it is not considered to be a safe place for swimming as the place is prone to high tides. The name of the beach comes from Gomti Mata temple which is located nearby. Distance From Ahmedabad: 375 Kms Attractions: Nagoa Beach, Diu Fort, Naida Caves 19. Jallandhar Beach It is believed that the name of this beach is given after a demon, located at a distance of 1 km from Diu. This sunny beach has a temple and also a memorial alongside the white sandy shores. The temple worships the Goddess Chandrika while the memorial holds a stone structure of the demon. There are also a wide array of water sports to enjoy here. Distance From Ahmedabad: 365 Kms Attractions: Nagoa Beach, Naida Caves Further Read: 20 Things To Do In Ahmedabad For An Extraordinary Experience Although all the beaches mentioned are far away from Ahmedabad, you can have a good 2-3 days weekend trip here. Ahmedabad is not surrounded by any coastal line and hence the beaches are quite far from the main city. So now when you plan a vacation to Gujarat, make sure that you add these beaches near Ahmedabad in your itinerary and have a great time amidst the surreal beaches. Frequently Asked Questions About Beaches Near Ahmedabad Does Ahmedabad have a beach? The city doesn’t have any beaches as such. Which beach is nearest to Ahmedabad? Dandi beach in Surat is the nearest to Ahmedabad. Which beach near to Ahmedabad is the best for a stay of 2-3 days? Diu coastal line is the must-visit beaches if you are planning for 3 days trip. Which beaches near Ahmedabad are good for a family? Dwarka, Somnath, Porbandar and Harihareshwar beaches are good for a family. Which beach near Ahmedabad is good for couples to spend time with? Kashid beach, Diveagar beach, and Alibag beach. Which beach near Ahmedabad has a great variety of adventure water sports? Diu, Alibag, Harihareshwar and Raigad beaches do have water sports.
